statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: McNeese St. 63, Southern Miss. 57
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Jarvis Bradley scored 19 points and McNeese State snapped Southern Miss' five-game winning streak with a 63-57 upset Sunday afternoon. Bradley hit a free throw to complete a three-point play with 1:31 left to break a 55-55 tie and the Cowboys (6-5) hit five of six free throws to take the victory and snap a two-game losing streak. Southern Miss, which beat its opponents by more than 24 points a game while sweeping the Gulf Coast Classic last week, struggled offensively, hitting just 30 percent its shots and finishing with 19 field goals. Jeremy Wise scored 25 points for Southern Miss and hit 14 of the Golden Eagles' first 16 points. Wise scored six straight late to help erase an eight-point Cowboys lead as Southern Miss tied the game, but Bradley's key three-point play sealed the win. McNeese State's Rorey Lawrence and John Pichon each added 13 points while R.L. Horton and Brandon Cooks scored 10 points apiece for Southern Miss.
